result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Lee Masch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the amount of $11,402.34:  $2,000.00 to crime Victim Compensation; $1,100.00 to George C.; $1,000.00 to Louise P.; $4,233.67 to Max A. Sass & Sons Funeral Home; $1,243.89 to Beatrice P.; $769.78 to Linda S.; and $1,055.00 to Mike F.

Pay all costs, assessments, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
AS TO RESTITUTION AND ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid through collection by DOC from up to 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that his voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Lee Masch

Petition and Stipulation to Amend Judgment of Conviction Probation Cases, filed.

Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch not in court, defendant in custody.  Alexander Dominic Cossi appeared for the City of Milwaukee. All parties appear via zoom.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST.   Case set for Return of Property Hearing. Petitioner Kathleen Masch appears as power of attorney for Benjamin Masch. Discussion placed on the record.  Court DENIED Petition for Return of Property.
Return of property hearing on October 25, 2021 at 01:30 pm.
Milwaukee Police Department Inventory # 14006613, #14006513

Kathleen Masch in court on behalf of defendant.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Return of Property Hearing held.  State objects to return of property.  For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED petitioners request.
Return of property hearing on August 9, 2021 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (39 pages) commencing 09/29/2014 SENTENCING TRANSCRIPT received and filed.
Associated with Charge #1
Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarcertation Credit

Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch in court with attorney Charles L. Glynn.  Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense.  The defendant will not be making a statement at the request of victim's family.   Additional statements by George C., Beatrice P., Kristi L., and Robert M.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 18 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 223 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 12 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Stipulated restitution in the amount of $11,402.34:
$2000.00 to Crime Victim Compensation
$1100.00 to George C.
$1000.00 to Louise P.
$4233.67 to Max A Sass Greenridge Chapel
$1243.89 to Beatrice P.
$ 769.78  to Linda S.
$1055.00 to Mike F.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS, ASSESSMENTS SURCHARGES AND RESTITUTION WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded.
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence filed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit filed.
Restitution information and letters on behalf of victim received from State.
Letters to the court (6) on behalf of defendant.

Defendant wishes to resolve matter with a plea to the Amended Information.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the AMENDED Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  
Parties waive a presentence investigation.  Defendant is remanded.  Case is adjourned to 9-29-2014 at 8:15 for sentencing.

Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch in court with attorney Charles L. Glynn.  Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AMENDED INFORMATION filed by the state:  Second Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, 940.06(1).
Addendum to State's Witness List filed.

Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch in court with attorney Charles L. Glynn.  Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case remains in trial posture for 8-18-2014.  The defense MAY be hiring an expert and the state MAY have an additional witness.  The Court directs that this is to be determined within the next 10 days.

Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch in court with attorney Charles L Glynn.  Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsels met with Court on 4-29-2014.  Defense is requesting an adjournment of the 5-5-2014 jury trial to allow time to hire an expert based on the filing of the Medical Examiner's Report.  The State does not object.  The Court will grant the adjournment.   Case set for final pretrial on 7-9-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 8-18-2014 at 8:15am.
State's Addendum to Witness List.

Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch in court with attorney Charles L Glynn.  Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch in custody.  Mark S Williams appeared Grant Huebner for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is advised that there are no evidentiary issues that need to be resolved in this matter.  The State has approximately 12 witnesses; that defense may have 1.  Case remains on for trial on 5-5-2014
Subpoena

Attorney Charles L. Glynn in court, defendant Benjamin Lee Masch not in court, in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for final pretrial on 4-21-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 5-5-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed within 17 days of today's date.  ls

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch in court with attorney Charles L. Glynn.  Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Dugan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Subpoena

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch in court with attorney Charles L Glynn.  Defendant Benjamin Lee Masch in custody.  Maureen A. Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  eam
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
